pr_title: [GEOS-9493] WFS GeoJSON complex features output issue on numeric typed xml attributes

timeline.message: [GEOS-9493] WFS GeoJSON complex features output issue on numeric typed xml attributes

timeline.bodyText: Why wouldn't this work outside of a database scenario?
timeline.author: aaime

replies.bodyText:
This is due 1..n cardinality on app-schema is only supported on JDBC and Solr backends, on Geoserver documentation: "Mappings with a one to many relationship are supported with a custom syntax in JDBC based data stores and Apache Solr data store."
https://docs.geoserver.org/stable/en/user/data/app-schema/mapping-file.html#attributes-with-cardinality-1-n
replies.author: fernandor777

replies.bodyText: I see, good to go then (well, when the builds are good enough at least, forget windows, but would like to see the Linux Travis one be all green).
replies.author: aaime
